sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of the Board (the Compensation Committee or the Committee) met five times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee oversees Grainger's compensation and benefits policies and programs (generally for all employees and specifically with respect to executives), makes executive compensation decisions, and reviews and recommends other compensation matters to be submitted to the Board and/or shareholders for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The general responsibilities of the Committee are to oversee that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation is aligned to shareholder value creation and strategic objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation, especially senior management compensation, is linked to both personal and Company performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company maintains a market competitive compensation structure that is designed to attract, motivate, develop, and retain key talent who deliver performance that will increase shareholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Company's compensation policies and practices for all employees are aligned with Company policy and strategy, are designed with appropriate incentives that do not encourage unnecessary or excessive risk-taking, and are administered in a transparent manner;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation and benefit policies and practices reflect the highest level of integrity; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: all stock and incentive plans are appropriately designed and administered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board has determined that each of the members of the Compensation Committee is "independent," as that term is defined in the independence quirements for members of compensation committees contained in the applicable standards of the SEC and the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews and approves corporate goals and objectives relevant to CEO compensation, evaluates CEO performance in light of those financial goals and objectives, and, together with the other independent directors (as directed by the Board), determines and approves the CEO's compensation based on this evaluation, in executive session without members of management present, and approves the compensation paid to the most highly compensated executives, the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In overseeing the Company's compensation programs, the Committee develops programs based on its own deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also considers programs and recommendations from its independent compensation consultant, a variety of other compensation and benefits consultants, and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a review of the factors prescribed by the SEC and the NYSE rules and regulations, the Committee determined that Deloitte Consulting is independent and has retained Deloitte Consulting as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent compensation consultant is solely hired by and reports directly to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee's practice is to routinely meet with the independent compensation consultant in executive session, without management present, following each Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has sole authority to retain and terminate the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: independent compensation consultant, including sole authority to approve the consultant's fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committee's direction, the independent compensation consultant:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attends Committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assists the Committee review goals and objectives for CEO compensation, including succession planning and transition activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assists the Committee in evaluating compensation proposals, including by providing compensation market data;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: helps analyze recommendations proposed by management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assists with the design of the structure and metrics for incentive compensation programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: responds to specific compensation-related inquiries, such as determining comparator companies used for compensation studies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conducts or assists in risk reviews of the Company's performance and incentive-based compensation programs; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provides periodic updates on executive compensation trends and developments and undertakes special projects as assign
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of management (including some of the Named Executive Officers) assist the Committee in performing its responsibilities by providing recommendations for the design of Grainger's compensation program for its Named Executive Officers, other officers, and other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also recommends salary and award levels, except those related to Mr. Ryan, Chairman of the Board, and Mr. Macpherson, Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson's salaries and awards are reviewed by the Committee, together with the other independent directors (as directed by the Board), in executive session without members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On issues of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer compensation, the independent directors of the Committee, in their sole discretion, determine the appropriate compensation design and level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee grants equity awards (stock options, restricted stock units (RSUs), and performance shares) to officers and other employees under the shareholder-approved 2015 Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has delegated to management limited authority to grant stock options and RSUs to non-officer employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under this authority are granted under the terms and conditions that have been approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pool of shares available to management under this delegation has been refreshed annually by the Committee to 20,000 stock options and 35,000 RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum amount that management is authorized to award to any individual is 5,000 stock options and 2,500 RSUs, and to avoid any real or perceived manipulated timing, all awards are effective the first business day of the month following the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information concerning the grants by management is shared with the Committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may terminate this delegation of authority at its discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has carefully considered its leadership structure and believes that a combined Chairman/Chief Executive Officer position represents the best long- term leadership structure for Grainger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the Board's view, having a single individual serving as both the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer assists in the timely flow of relevant information which supports effective Board decision-making and provides a useful connection between the Board and management so that Board actions are appropriately executed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board's Lead Director structure helps assure these functions are properly performed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe that permanently separating the role of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer would result
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 20   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in strengthening Grainger's corporate governance or in creating or enhancing long-term value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has strong governance structures and processes in place to ensure the independence of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These established structures and processes, which are reflected in the Operating Principles for the Board of Directors and the various Board Committee charters, provide for the independent directors to exercise authority so that the Board is effective in overseeing critical matters of strategy, operations, and reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important duties performed by the ndependent directors, either collectively or through committees made up solely of independent directors, include selecting the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and evaluating his or her performance and the resulting compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board generally believes that splitting the roles of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is unnecessary and not in the best interest of shareholders, effective October 1, 2016, as part of a planned succession process, the Company temporarily separated the two positions naming Mr. Macpherson Chief Executive Officer, with Mr. Ryan continuing to serve as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Concurrently with his appointment as Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Macpherson was also appointed to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior steps in the succession planning included promoting Mr. Macpherson to Chief Operating Officer in August 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that role, Mr. Macpherson was responsible for the Company's day-to-day operations and reported to Mr. Ryan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Macpherson had served the Company in various roles as a Senior Vice President and Group President since 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Ryan's continued service as Board Chairman has enabled the Company to execute a smooth transition of the Chief Executive Officer role, while ensuring that the Board and Mr. Macpherson have retained Mr. Ryan and his significant knowledge of the Company's operations, strategy, people and resources during the succession process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In deciding that a combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer position is the appropriate long-term leadership structure for Grainger, the Board also recognized the need for independent leadership and oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1995, Grainger's Operating Principles for the Board of Directors have assigned a leadership role to the independent director serving as Chair of the Board Affairs and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over time, this director has been responsible for facilitating Board involvement on major issues and/or proposals, reviewing meeting agenda and information to be provided to the Board, consulting with directors, the Chief Executive Officer, and management and presiding at executive sessions of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010, the Board revised its Operating Principles and by-laws to create the leadership position of Lead Director, to be elected annually by and from the Board's independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the duties assigned to the Lead Director is the responsibility for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: presiding at meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: serving as the primary liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and approving the types of information sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and approving meeting agenda for the Board to ensure that critical issues are included;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and approving meeting schedules to ensure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conducting the Board's annual self-evaluation, including coordinating Board committee evaluations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: working with the Compensation Committee and leading the Chairman/Chief Executive Officer evaluation and communicating to the Chairman/Chief Executive Officer the independent directors' annual evaluation of the Chairman/Chief Executive Officer's performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling meetings of the independent directors if appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that given Grainger's corporate governance structures and processes, a combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer position in conjunction with an independent Lead Director provides effective oversight of management by the Board and results in a high level of management accountability to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board, Committee and Director Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Board conducts a three-part evaluation process coordinated by the Lead Director and the Committee Chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The evaluation framework is constituted of the following.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full Board Evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director completes a questionnaire designed to evaluate overall Board effectiveness and identify opportunities for improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board evaluation seeks to determine how the Board can improve its key function of maximizing long term shareholder value and considers a number of factors, including, among others, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board composition and governance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board agendas, meeting materials and discussions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board communications and interactions with management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive sessions of the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: director experience, training and continuing education processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director completes a questionnaire designed to evaluate overall effectiveness and identify opportunities for improvement with respect to each Committee in which he or she serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluations consider a number of factors, including, among others, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Committee's governance and structure;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee meetings, materials and discussions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a Committee's interactions with management and outside advisors or consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Self-Assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director completes a self-assessment designed to evaluate the performance and effectiveness of the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director self-assessments consider a number of factors, including, among others, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: preparation and information for Board and Committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributions to Board and Committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: interactions with the Board and management; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continuing education and training opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These questionnaires ask directors to assign ratings to how the Board performs and seek feedback on more open-ended topics, including Board and Committee processes and effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The evaluation framework and process is reviewed periodically with an outside corporate governance expert, including as to opportunities to enhance Board effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the evaluations are compiled anonymously and include responses and comments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the completed Board evaluations and individual director self-assessments are furnished to the Lead Director, while the results of the completed evaluations for the Committees are furnished to the corresponding Committee Chairs, and then discussed at the Board and Committee meetings, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following discussion of the reports at the Board and respective Committee meetings, the Lead Director and the Committee Chairs develop plans for any items that may warrant additional action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information gained through this process helps inform the content of educational presentations to the Board as well as the skills sets desirable in director searches conducted by the Board from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Board's 2016 evaluation process and related follow-up, the Board identified the need for director candidates with proven track records of strategic thinking and experience in eCommerce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board's Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has overall responsibility for risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its role is to oversee risk assessment and risk management processes and policies used by Grainger to identify, assess, monitor and address potential financial, compensation, operational, strategic and legal risks on an enterprise-wide basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risks monitored include threats to information technology systems and other issues of cyber security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also regularly reviews Grainger's risk assessment and risk management processes and policies, including receiving regular reports from the members of Grainger's management who are responsible for risk assessment and risk management on the effectiveness of Grainger's Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its oversight responsibility, the Compensation Committee assesses the relationship between potential risk created by Grainger's compensation programs and their impact on long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning and Management Development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes that it has an important duty to ensure senior leadership continuity by overseeing the development of executive talent and planning for the efficient succession of the Chief Executive Officer and other key leadership positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has delegated primary oversight responsibility for succession planning and management development to the Board Affairs and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reports on its activities to the full Board, which routinely addresses succession planning during executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board generally conducts an in-depth review of senior leader development and succession planning, including emergency succession scenarios, at least once a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review addresses the Company's management development initiatives, assesses senior management resources, and identifies individuals who should be considered as potential future senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that the succession planning and management development process supports and enhances Grainger's strategic objectives, the Board and the Board Affairs and Nominating Committee also regularly consult with the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer on the Company's organizational needs, the leadership potential and related development plans for key managers, and plans for uture developments and emergency situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Available Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grainger has adopted Business Conduct Guidelines for directors, officers, and employees, incorporating the Code of Ethics required by rules of the SEC to be applicable to a company's chief executive officer, chief financial officer, and chief accounting officer or controller, and intends to satisfy any disclosure requirements with respect to the Business Conduct Guidelines by posting the information on its website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grainger also has adopted Operating Principles for the Board of Directors, which represent its corporate governance guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grainger's non-employee directors each receive an annual cash retainer of $85,000 and an annual deferred stock grant of $145,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors serving as Committee Chairs receive an additional annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grainger's non-employee directors are compensated at a level that approximates median market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In benchmarking director pay, Grainger uses the same compensation comparator group that is used to benchmark compensation for Grainger's executives as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant periodically reviews the comparator group as well as comparative information and advises on director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors' compensation program, which was last adjusted in 2015, consisted of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual cash retainer for each director of $85,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: deferred stock grant for each director of $145,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: chair retainers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee: $20,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee: $15,000; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Affairs and Nominating Committee: $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual retainer for the Lead Director of $25,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-employee directors receive an annual deferred stock unit grant worth $145,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares covered by each grant is equal to $145,000 divided by the 200-day average stock price through January 31 (a methodology consistent with the calculation used for equity awards to Grainger executives), rounded up to the next ten-share increment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deferred stock units are settled in shares upon termination of service as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may also defer their annual cash retainers, lead director retainer, committee chair retainers (as applicable), and meeting fees in a deferred stock unit account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines applicable to non-employee directors were established in 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines provide that within five years after election, a director must own Grainger common stock and common stock equivalents having a value of at least five times the annual cash retainer fee for serving on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also states that any pledged shares cannot be used to meet the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pledging of Company shares by directors or executive officers is prohibited by Company policy (see further details under the "Hedging and Pledging Prohibition" section).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No directors have pledged any of the shares beneficially owned by them and all directors are currently in compliance with the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Grainger matches directors' charitable contributions on a three-to-one basis up to a maximum Company contribution of $7,500 annually and provides discounts on product purchases, both on the same basis as provided to U.S. Grainger employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director who is an employee of Grainger or any Grainger subsidiary does not receive any compensation for serving as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 16(a) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our directors and officers and persons who own more than 10% of our common stock to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC and the NYSE, and to furnish us with copies of the reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specific due dates for these reports are prescribed by SEC rules and we are required to report in this proxy statement any failure by directors, officers, or 10% holders to file such reports on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our review of such reports and written representations from our directors and officers, we believe that all such filing requirements were timely met during 2016, except for two Forms 4 that were filed late with respect to two 2015 sales by James D. Slavik to certain family trusts of equity interests in an entity through which he beneficially owns shares of Grainger common stock.

sentences.text: Report of the Audit Committee of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each of the members of the Audit Committee is "independent," as that term is defined in the independence requirements for audit committee members contained in the applicable rules of the SEC and corporate governance standards of the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee acts under a charter that is reviewed annually, was last amended by the Board on December 1, 2015, and is available on the Governance section of Grainger's website at www.grainger.com/investor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for the Company's internal controls and the financial reporting process and for compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP ("Ernst & Young"), the Company's independent auditor, was responsible for performing an independent audit of the Company's most recent consolidated financial statements and expressing an opinion on the conformity of those financial statements with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America, as well as expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company's internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee's responsibility is to monitor and oversee these processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In performing these responsibilities, the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed the Company's audited consolidated financial statements and the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting with management and Ernst & Young.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with Ernst & Young matters required to be discussed under Statement on Auditing Standards No. 1301 "Communications with Audit Committees" adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board ("PCAOB").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young also provided to the Audit Committee the letter and written disclosures required by PCAOB standards concerning Ernst & Young's independence and the Audit Committee discussed with Ernst & Young the matter of the firm's independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions described above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, as filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: E. Scott Santi, Chair Brian P. Anderson V. Ann Hailey Neil S. Novich Members of the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors 30   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consists of fees billed for professional services rendered for the audits of Grainger's annual financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, review of the interim financial statements included in Grainger's quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, and other services normally provided in connection with Grainger's statutory and regulatory filings or engagements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consists of fees billed for professional services rendered for assurance and related services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of Grainger's financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services include the audits of Grainger's employee benefit plans and various attest services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consists of fees billed for professional services rendered for tax compliance, tax advice and tax planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services include assistance with the preparation of various tax returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consists of fees billed for all other professional services rendered to Grainger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policy for Audit and Non-Audit Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted a policy for the pre-approval of all audit and permitted non-audit services to be provided to Grainger by its independent auditor and is responsible for the review and approval of any fees associated with those services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee is required for any proposed services exceeding pre-approved fee levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-approvals for categories of services are granted at the start of each fiscal year and are applicable for 12 months from the date of pre-approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering these pre-approvals, the Audit Committee reviews detailed supporting documentation from the independent auditor for each proposed service to be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unused pre-approval amounts are not carried forward to the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's Controller monitors services provided by the independent auditor and overall compliance with the pre-approval policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Controller reports periodically to the Audit Committee about the status of outstanding engagements, including actual services provided and associated fees, and must promptly report any noncompliance with the pre-approval policy to the Chairman of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee may delegate pre-approval authority for audit and non-audit services to one or more of its members, and such authority has been delegated to the Chair of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decisions of any member to whom such authority is delegated must be presented to the full Audit Committee at its next scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee may not delegate to management its responsibilities to pre-approve services performed by th Company's independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee periodically reviews reports summarizing all services provided by the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal to Ratify the Appointment of Independent Auditor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent external audit firm that performs audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering Ernst & Young's appointment for the 2017 fiscal year, the Committee reviewed the firm's qualifications and competencies, including the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young's historical performance and its recent performance during its engagement for the 2016 fiscal year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young's capability and expertise in handling the breadth and complexity of the Company's operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the qualifications and experience of key members of the engagement team, including the lead audit partner, for the audit of the Company's financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the quality of Ernst & Young's communications with the Audit Committee regarding the conduct of the audit, and with management with respect to issues identified in the audit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: external data on audit quality and performance, including recent PCAOB reports on Ernst & Young; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young's reputation for integrity and competence in the fields of accounting and auditing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has been retained as the Company's independent auditor continuously since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to ensure continuing auditor independence, the Committee periodically considers whether there should be a regular rotation of the independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee ensures that the mandated rotation of Ernst & Young's personnel occurs routinely and the Audit Committee and its Chairman are directly involved in the selection of Ernst & Young's lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors believe that the continued retention of Ernst & Young to serve as the Company's independent auditor for the year ending December 31, 2017 is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders, and the Board is asking shareholders to ratify this appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young are expected to be present at the meeting to respond to appropriate questions of shareholders and to make any desired statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Board recommends a vote FOR the proposal to ratify the appointment of independent audit
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the proposal requires the affirmative votes of a majority of the shares of Grainger common stock represented in person or by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the same effect as votes against the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event the proposal is not approved, the Board will consider the negative vote as a mandate to appoint another independent auditor for the next year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As explained under "Leadership Changes" below, between January 1, 2016 and September 30, 2016, Mr. Ryan served as the Company's Chairman, President and CEO, while Mr. Macpherson served as the Company's Chief Operating Officer (COO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long term CEO succession planning is crucial to the stability of the business and a key responsibility of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective October 1, 2016, as part of a planned succession process, the Company named Mr. Macpherson CEO, with Mr. Ryan continuing to serve as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Concurrent with his appointment as CEO, Mr. Macpherson was also appointed to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior steps in the succession planning included promoting Mr. Macpherson to COO in August 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that role, Mr. Macpherson was responsible for the Company's day-to-day operations and reported to Mr. Ryan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Macpherson had served the Company as Senior Vice President and Group President, Global Supply Chain and International since 2013; Senior Vice President and President, Global Supply Chain and Corporate Strategy, a position assumed in 2012; and Senior Vice President, Global Supply Chain, a position assumed in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Ryan's continued service as Chairman of the Board has enabled the Company to execute a smooth transition of the CEO role, while ensuring that the Board and Mr. Macpherson have retained Mr. Ryan and his significant knowledge of the Company's operations, strategy, people and resources during the succession process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's compensation program is based upon a philosophy that is applied to all Company employeesto attract and retain the best people and provide them appropriate performance-based incentives that encourage them to achieve results that create long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he overall compensation structure is designed to drive profitable growth leading to shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees at all levels of the Company, ncluding its executives, are provided incentives to grow the business (Sales Growth) while achieving attractive investment returns (Return on Invested Capital, or ROIC) for the Company's shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executives, the compensation program is designed to link pay to performance and is structured to eward both annual and long-term Company performance while not encouraging excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The basic compensation structure did not change in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as a result of long term succession planning, Mr. Macpherson was promoted to CEO and became a member of the Board of Directors while Mr. Ryan continued in the role of Chairman of the Board (COB);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: financial results did not meet expectations and therefore the payouts for both the annual bonus payments and long-term performance share program were below target; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: effective with the 2017 long term incentive grants, the Company will change the long term incentive mix from 70% stock options and 30% performance shares to 50% stock options and 50% performance shares in response to market practice and to provide appropriate incentives to drive shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO compensation includes a combination of base salary, short-term incentives, long-term equity incentives including performance shares and stock options, and a performance-based retirement vehicle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These components are combined to provide Company executives with appropriate incentives for profitable long- term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO base salaries and long-term incentive grants are determined based on many factors including individual performance, responsibilities, and the overall relation to market levels of compensation.

sentences.text: The Company is focused on profitable daily sales growth over the short- and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using ROIC and sales growth for both short-term and long-term incentive awards does not create unreasonable risk because:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different Performance Goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive program focuses on sales growth compared to the prior year and a pre-determined ROIC, with both measures linked to the Company's one-year plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-term incentive program focuses on a specific sales dollar goal in the third year of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the long-term incentive program requires a threshold level of ROIC over the performance period in order for the awards to vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Different Time Periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The short-term incentive program focuses on the achievement of sales growth and ROIC over one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The long-ter incentive program focuses on sales growth over three years, while maintaining an ROIC above 18% during the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company-Wide Performance Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance is measured at the Company- wide level as opposed to specific business unit or regional levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum Payout is Capped.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive plans are capped at 200% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy, Plans, and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Company's pay for performance philosophy, the Company's compensation program includes several features that maintain alignment with shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasis on Variable Performance-Based Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 73% of the NEOs' target compensation is tied to Company performance that the Company believes drives shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Change in Control Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the existing Change in Control Agreements and awards under the 2015 Incentive Plan have double-trigger change in control provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the Chairman and CEO are required to hold equity in the Company worth at least 6x their base salaries, and all other NEOs are required to hold at least 3x base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holding/Retention Periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are required to hold exercised stock option shares and other stock awards until ownership requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those who fail to achieve ownership requirements will not receive future equity-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on Hedging and Pledging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs and directors are prohibited from hedging and future pledging of Company shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has established recoupment policies for financial fraud and/or material inaccuracies as well as for violations of non-competition agreements and non-solicitation agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Thresholds and Caps.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the annual incentive and performance share programs require a threshold level of performance in order to achieve any payment, and the maximum payments are capped.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Risk Reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company conducts an annual risk review based on a process recommended by the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimal Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's compensation programs also maintain alignment with shareholders by not including certain features:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Cash Buyouts of Underwater Stock Options, Repricing, or Stock Options issued at a discount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options issued will not be repriced, replaced, or regranted through cancellation or by lowering the exercise price of a previously granted stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Excessive Change in Control Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum cash benefit is equal to 2x salary and target bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Change in Control Agreements with Excise Tax Gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross-ups on Perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Employment Agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not maintain any employment agreements with its NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Payment of Dividend Equivalents on Unearned Performance Shares or Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, the Company's compensation program is designed to be straightforward and understandable to its employees and shareholders, and to drive long- erm shareholder value creation by aligning compensation with both individual and Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of the Board is responsible for the Company's compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the Company's compensation and benefit programs for all officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for ensuring that the Company's compensation practices provide appropriate incentives to increase long-term shareholder value, reflect the highest level of integrity, and protect the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of its responsibilities is to make certain that a competitive compensation structure is in place that will attract, reward, and retain employees and to motivate them to grow the business profitably.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is also charged with ensuring that compensation, especially for executives, is linked to both individual and Company performance, and ensuring that compensation policies and practices for all employees do not include incentives to take inappropriate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting individual compensation levels, the Compensation Committee selects a compensation comparator group of companies and reviews studies of total compensation paid to executives in those comparator group companies with similar duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then considers a variety of reference points, including competitive compensation data at the 25th, 50th, and 75th percentiles, individual and Company performance, the executive's overall experience, replaceability, internal equity, unique skills, and management's recommendation to determine appropriate compensation for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All elements of compensation are valued and reviewed in evaluating the relative competitiveness of the Company's compensation practices against the comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target total compensation for the Company's employees and executives as a whole (including the NEOs) is generally set to approximate the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews at least annually a tally sheet for each NEO to evaluate the potential value of all compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheet includes each NEO's current base salary, annual incentive award, and the value of all outstanding equity-based awards (both vested and unvested), deferrals, benefits, and perquisites, as well as potential payments under retirement and certain change in control situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since no NEO has an employment agreement with the Company that guarantees continued employment, the tally sheets also facilitate the Committee's evaluation of the reasonableness of awards and their likely retention value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Compensation Committee makes executive compensation decisions and recommends actions to the Board of Directors and to shareholders (for example, related to the advisory Say on Pay vote or equity plan proposals), as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n discharging its responsibilities, the Committee regularly consults with independent advisors, compensation consultants, and the Company's management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a review of the factors prescribed by the SEC and the NYSE, the Compensation Committee determined that its compensation consultant, Deloitte Consulting, is an independent advisor under the applicable rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's charter can be found in the Governance section of Grainger's website at www.grainger.com/investor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee's oversight responsibility includes assessing the relationship between potential risk created by the Company's compensation programs and their impact on long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's compensation programs are designed to include risk-mitigating features, and the Committee also engaged its independent compensation consultant (Deloitte Consulting) to assist with the process of an annual internal risk assessment of all incentive-based compensation, including short-term and long-term incentive programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incentive compensation programs include risk-mitigating components, such as:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: balanced performance measuressales growth combined with profitability;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: robust performance measure selection and goal setting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: balanced mix of short-term and long-term incentives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: balanced mix of equity vehiclesstock options are combined with performance shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: clawback provisions to recoup incentive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock ownership, retention, and holding requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2009, the Committee has engaged its independent compensation consultant to conduct a risk assessment that is completed every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent consultant will conduct its next risk assessment in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the interim years, the Company conducts an annual internal risk review based on practices and methodologies recommended by the Committee's independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the internally-conducted 2016 risk review were discussed with the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the risk review and the Committee's discussions, the Committee does not believe that the Company's compensation policies and practices are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders, the advisory vote to approve the compensation of the Company's NEOs received the support of 96% of the shareholders voting on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has considered these results and believes that they confirm the appropriateness of the Company's current executive compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company routinely discusses its compensation philosophy with its shareholders as part of investor relations activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is required to check with shareholders on the frequency of the advisory Say on Pay vote every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011 and 2017, management recommended an annual advisory Say on Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The next advisory frequency vote is scheduled for 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management assists the Compensation Committee in the design, recommendation, and implementation of compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of management assist the Compensation Committee by routinely recommending programs that management believes will provide the appropriate level of compensation and incentives consistent with the Company's compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this process, management works with advisors from Aon Hewitt to develop market information and recommends adjustments in base salaries, annual incentive targets, and long-term incentive awards to be reviewed by the Compensation Committee and approved by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For NEOs other than Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson, the recommendations also include the structure and targets of short-term and long-term incentive programs, as well as changes to programs required for regulatory compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These recommendations are reviewed and approved by the both the Chairman of the Board and the CEO before they are presented to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson's compensation is reviewed by the Compensation Committee in conjunction with its independent compensation consultant, together with other independent directors (as directed by the Board), in executive session without members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Comparator Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's compensation program is regularly benchmarked against a Compensation Committee-approved comparator group of companies that are similar to the Company in size and complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company performs these studies to understand current market practices and to provide a reference point for compensation discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every other year, the Compensation Committee determines a compensation comparator group of companies and undertakes a study of total compensation paid to executives occupying similar positions with similar duties and responsibilities in the comparator companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All elements of compensation are valued and considered when determining the relative competitiveness of the Company's compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A comparator group compensation study was onducted in 2016 (2016 Compensation Study).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 comparator group consists of 22 businesses that are relatively similar in complexity and size to the Company and represent the types of major companies with which the Company historically competes for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies that were selected for the 2016 Compensation Study are generally within a range of 0.5 to 2.0 times Grainger's annual revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The competitive market for executive talent includes companies both within and outside the same industry or sector as the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of the Company's publicly traded direct competitors tend to be too small in sales or scope of operations for direct compensation comparisons with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Including a broader range of companies provides a more representative depiction of the Company's competitive market for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, companies used for compensation comparison purposes differ from those in the industry indices used in the Company Performance Graph in Part II, Item 5 of the Company's most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management played a minimal role in selecting the 2016 compensation comparator group, as the Committee relied on Aon Hewitt for survey and market data and its independent compensation consultant (Deloitte Consulting) for assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role of management in selecting the comparator group was limited to providing general comments on the relevance of each industry represented by the comparator companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are intended to provide an appropriate level of fixed compensation to attract and retain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are determined after a detailed evaluation of individual performance, competitive market levels, and executive experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual base salary adjustments are considered and implemented to reflect individual performance, contribution and experience, and to maintain market competitiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Compensation Study showed that, on average, the Company's base salaries for NEOs were approximately 2% below the market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary increases for the NEOs, with the exception of Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson, are reviewed and approved by both the Chairman of the Board and the CEO before they are presented to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving recommendations, the Committee reviews these recommendations in conjunction with its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation awarded to Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson is determined by the Board with assistance from the Compensation Committee and its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves the corporate goals and objectives relevant to Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson's compensation and evaluates each individual's performance in light of those goals and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Together with the other independent directors (as directed by the Board), the Compensation Committee determines and approves Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson's compensation level based on this evaluation, in executive session without members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the annual performance management review process (which is similar to the process in which all employees participate), base salaries are reviewed and adjusted (if appropriate) to reflect individual and Company performance, base salaries for comparable positions from market studies, experience, tenure, and internal equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the process outlined above, on April 1, 2016, Mr. Ryan's base salary was increased to $1,191,942 (+3.0%) and Mr. Macpherson's base salary was increased to $850,000 (+6.3%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as a result of the Company naming him Chief Executive Officer on October 1, 2016, Mr. Macpherson's base salary was increased to $1,000,000 (+17.6%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the following base salary adjustments were made for the other NEOs effective April 1, 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jadin's base salary was increased to $727,180 (+3.0%);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Howard's base salary was increased to $678,770 (+3.0%);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. High's base salary was increased to $500,000 (+4.0%); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Robbins' base salary was increased to $441,025 (+5.0%) and subsequently increased to $465,000 (+5.4%) effective October 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentives are intended to provide an appropriate level of variable compensation to encourage executives to achieve annual results that create shareholder value without encouraging excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are eligible to receive short-term cash-based incentives on the achievement of specified annual Company-wide financial performance measures set orth in the Company Management Incentive Program (MIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company structures the MIP to motivate performance that balances short-term and long- erm results and aligns the interests of management with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NEO's target incentive award under the annual incentive program is based on a review of competitive market practice and is designed to approximate a market value that is generally at the median of the comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table displays the 2016 MIP target (program and payment) applicable to each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name 2016 Target Incentive (as a % of base salary) Program Actual Payment (as a % of the target)   James T. Ryan   130%   Company   75%   D.G. Macpherson 125%* Company 75%   Ronald L. Jadin   85%   Company   75%   John L. Howard 75% Company 75%   Joseph C. High   75%   Company   75%   Paige K. Robbins 55% Company 75%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Mr. Macpherson's 2016 incentive payment was increased from 100% to 125% effective October 1, 2016, in connection with his promotion to CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, his 2016 incentive amount is pro-rated at 100% for 9 months and 125% for 3 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and management perform a thorough analysis in setting financial measures and goals for the Company MIP to ensure the program appropriately balances the Company's objectives, is aligned with long-term shareholder interest, and has appropriate and effective risk-mitigating components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the measures and goals are clearly aligned with the Company's strategy, they also account for current economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combination of sales growth and ROIC performance, as well as threshold, target, and maximum payment levels, serves to mitigate risk to the Company's shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes the design of the annual incentive program creates shareholder value and encourages performance by focusing on profitable sales growth and ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The basic framework of the MIP has been in place for more than ten years, although specific objectives and performance target levels have been modified on a year-by-year basis in light of the current economic and competitive environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This framework was selected to align with Company strategy and to balance sales growth with profitability, efficiency, expense management, and asset management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROIC reflects how effectively management uses Company assets and is generally defined by the Company as pre-tax operating earnings divided by net working assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year-over-year daily sales growth is determined by year-over-year results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acquisitions and divestitures that occur during the year are not included in the calculation of daily sales growth or ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures are consistent with the Company's objective of growing profitably over time, which it believes is closely linked with shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 46   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Company MIP was based on the Company's ROIC and year-over-year daily sales growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company determined the payment earned for ROIC and the payment earned for sales growth, and the two amounts were added together:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MIP Payment=(Sales Growth Performance+ROIC Performance)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows various payout scenarios that were established at the beginning of the year:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Management Incentive Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROIC Performance % Payout* <21.60%   0% 21.60% 50% 24.10%**   75% 26.60% 100% Daily Sales Growth Performance % Payout* 5.50%**   0% 6.15% 25% 6.80%   50% 8.10% 100%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Payouts are interpolated on a straight-line basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ** For the year 2016, sales growth was 1.6% and adjusted ROIC was 24.1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these results, Company MIP paid at 75% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that it establishes sales growth and ROIC targets that are rigorous and provide an appropriate level of motivation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Terms and Conditions of the MIP, the Committee has the discretion to adjust the reported financial results for incentive plan purposes to correct for any unusual circumstances, both positive and negative, that might affect ROIC or sales growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee adjusted ROIC for the impact of certain items that the Company believes are not indicative of ongoing operations relating to (1) accounting adjustments related to customer unclaimed property; (2) increasing the Company's pre-tax reserve for resolving tax, freight, and miscellaneous billing issues relating to government contracts with the General Services Administration; and (3) the impairment charge attributable to the Fabory Group to reflect the Company's operating performance during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A more detailed discussion of these items is included in Part II, Item 6 and Item 8, Note 17 to the Consolidate Financial Statements, of the Company's most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The net effect of these adjustments increased the Company MIP payout from 62% to 75% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive amounts paid to Messrs. Ryan, Macpherson, Jadin, Howard, and High were based on the performance targets established for the 2016 MIP and were made under a separate annual incentive program described in the 2015 Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program is designed to ensure that annual incentives are performance-based and fully tax deductible by the Company under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the program, the Committee allocates a portion of an incentive pool to each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pool is funded with 5% of the Company's net earnings and the independent members of the Board have the authority to make specific awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sum of the individual participants' percentages may not be greater than 100% of the pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent members of the Board may use their discretion to reduce these amounts but may not increase them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with prior years, the independen members of the Board used their discretion to reduce the amounts to yield payments equal to those that would have made using the same financial target and measures as the 2016 MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with current practice, the 2017 MIP will continue to utilize daily sales growth along with ROIC as performance measures and all NEOs will be aligned to the Company MIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company annually provides long-term incentives to NEOs and other key managers in order to align with the following elements of the Company's strategy to improve shareholder value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achieve long-term business goals and objectives that increase shareholder value (including achieving financial performance that balances growth, profitability, and asset management);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reward management for taking prudent action and achieving results that create shareholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attract qualified leaders to join the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: retain management through business cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Company's long-term incentives for NEOs consist of stock options and performance shares and are provided under shareholder-approved incentive lans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Company structured awards such that stock options represent approximately 70% of the total value of long-term incentive compensation nd performance shares represent approximately 30% of the total value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Providing a mix of different types of equity awards is consistent with market practice or senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using both stock options and performance shares provides incentives to drive shareholder value creation and the three year vesting chedule aids in executive retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target number of shares provided for stock options and performance share awards is designed to approximate an economic value that targets the median of the compensation comparator group for comparable jobs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually establishes the target value of the award based on the executive's position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual award may be adjusted up or down to reflect individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value is converted to shares using the 200-day average stock price as of January 31 in the year of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of the 200-day average to calculate the number of shares is intended to smooth stock price volatility that can distort the number of shares awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award   Weight   Vesting & Term   Performance Measure Stock Options      70%      3-year cliff vesting; 10 year term      Grant allocated based on individual performance; long-term value based on appreciation in stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares     30%     3-year cliff vesting contingent on performance     Sales growth measured in year 3 of the performance cycle, with 3-year average ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's stock options provide the right to purchase Company stock at a specified price over a ten-year term with three-year cliff vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are intended to directly link management's and shareholders' interests by tying a substantial portion of long-term incentives to stock price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ten- year term is designed to focus the NEOs on long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-year cliff vesting encourages meaningful retention before an executive can realize any value created by stock price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock option repricing is not permitted under any of the Company's equity incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are awarded at an exercise price equal to the closing price of the Company's common stock reported on the business day of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's performance share program provides the NEOs and other executives with a potential share payout depending on sales growth and ROIC achievement over a three-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual number of shares paid to an NEO can range from 0% to 200% of the target number of performance shares awarded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee (with the assistance of its independent compensation consultant) and management perform a thorough analysis in setting the financial measures and goals for a three-year performance cycle that begins January 1 of the first year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sales growth component is measured at the end of the cycle's third year and the ROIC component is measured at the end of the third year based on the three-year average.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measurement dates reinforce a long term focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents are not paid on performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the three-year cycle that each award covers, the Company has three performance share cycles ongoing at all times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 Performance Share Cycle
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 performance share cycle, the 2016 sales target of $11.9 billion was established when 2013 sales were $9.4 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's net sales in 2016 determined the number of shares earned, while vesting remained dependent on meeting a three year average ROIC hurdle of 18%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout of the target performance share awards for this program cycle was made according to the following table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Total Company Sales Payout as a Percent of Target <$10.0B   0% $10.0B 50% $10.1B*   54%* $11.9B   100% $12.6B 200%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * In 2016, sales were $10.1 billion and the participants conditionally earned 54% of their target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the award vested because the Company's average ROIC for the three year period 2014-2016 was greater than 18%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015-2017 Performance Share Cycle
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015-2017 performance share cycle, the 2017 sales target of $12.2 billion was established when 2014 sales were $10.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's net sales in 2017 will determine the number of shares earned, while vesting remains dependent on meeting a three year average ROIC hurdle of 18%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout of the target performance share awards for this program cycle will be made according to the following table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Total Company Sales Payout as a Percent of Target <$10.6B   0% $10.6B 50% $12.2B   100% $13.3B 200%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sales of $12.2 billion in 2017 are required for participants to earn 100% of target award, assuming the average ROIC for the three-year period 2015-2017 is greater than 18%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award remains at risk through 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
