sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016-2018 Performance Share Cycle
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016-2018 performance share cycle, the program was designed to reward for achieving a three-year average ROIC and 2018 sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sales goal was established when 2015 sales were $10.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's average ROIC performance over the three-year period ending in 2018 and net sales in 2018 will determine the number of shares earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout of the target performance share awards for this program cycle will be made according to the following table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3-Year Average ROIC Performance (2016 - 2018) % Payout* 21.6%   0% 23.8% 50% 26.0%   100% Total Company 2018 Sales % Payout* $11.2B   0% $11.7B 50% $12.2B   100%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Payouts are interpolated on a straight-line basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three-year average ROIC at or above 26% or sales at or above $12.2 billion in 2018 can independently achieve 100% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieving both will yield 200% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This award will remain at risk through 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these performance measures because they balance sales growth with long-term profitability, expense management, and asset management and align with objectives established in the annual incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may use different sales growth and ROIC objectives and targets from year to year to maximize alignment with then-current business objectives and to reflect economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017-2019 performance share cycle will continue to include both three-year ROIC and three-year sales growth targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Vested Restricted Stock Units and Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with Grainger's historical practice of promotional awards with seven-year cliff vesting, the Company granted 8,896 performance-vested restricted stock units (PRSUs) to Mr. Macpherson to recognize his promotion to Chief Executive Officer effective October 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential share payout on the 7th anniversary of the grant is dependent on achieving average ROIC over 18% during a three-year performance cycle commencing October 1, 2016 through September 30, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual number of PRSUs that vest on the 7th anniversary of the grant will be either 0% or 100% of the number of shares awarded, based on achievement of the ROIC goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents are not paid on PRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company granted 481 restricted stock units (RSUs) to Ms. Robbins with three-year cliff vesting effective November 1, 2016, to recognize her increased responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changing Mix of Stock Options and Performance Shares for 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Company is planning to change the mix of long-term incentives 70% stock options and 30% performance shares to a 50%/50% balance of both vehicles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change is designed to be responsive to market practices while continuing to provide appropriate incentives to drive shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all officers subject to stock ownership guidelines, including the NEOs, are in compliance with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company continues to believe that requiring executive ownership of Company stock creates alignment between executives and shareholders and encourages executives to act to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increase shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1996, the Company established stock ownership guidelines for its NEOs and other officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, the Company increased the minimum ownership requirement for the CEO from 5x base salary to 6x and established a retention ratio for equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership guidelines for the NEOs are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO   Minimum Ownership Requirement as a Percentage of Base Salary   Currently in Compliance?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James T. Ryan      6x      Yes D.G. Macpherson     6x     Yes Ronald L. Jadin      3x      Yes John L. Howard     3x     Yes Joseph C. High      3x      Yes Paige K. Robbins     3x     Yes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock ownership guidelines must be met within three years of being appointed an officer or assuming a new position and are reviewed annually by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are required to hold exercised option shares and other stock awards until ownership requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers who fail to achieve these ownership levels will not receive future equity-based awards until they comply with the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned directly by the officer (including those held as a joint tenant or as tenant in common), RSUs, shares owned in a self-directed IRA, and certain shares owned or held for the benefit of a spouse or minor children are counted toward meeting the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options (whether vested or unvested) and performance share awards are not counted toward meeting the ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 25% Retention Ratio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is the Company's long-term goal for executives to also meet a second ownership requirement that is expressed in outright ownership (in actual shares and/or deferred vested shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has implemented a required 25% after-tax share retention ratio for NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon receiving shares from the Company following the exercise or settlement of equity awards, if NEOs do not hold outright ownership of shares worth the required ownership multiple, they will be required to retain 25% of the shares received from all such equity awards (net of any shares used to satisfy tax withholding obligations) until the stock ownership guidelines are met with shares owned outright.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging and Pledging Prohibition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's Business Conduct Guidelines (which are available in the Governance section of Grainger's website at www.grainger.com/investor) prohibit employees and the Board of Directors from engaging in any financial arrangement (including, without limitation, put and call options and short sales) that establish a short position in Company stock and are designed to hedge or offset a decrease in market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2013, by policy, Company officers and directors are also prohibited from pledging any additional Company stock at any amount as collateral for a loan or for a margin account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other components of the Company's compensation program for NEOs are substantially similar to those available for most of the Company's other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes the same health and welfare benefits and the same performance-based profit sharing contribution methodology that is applied to the U.S.-based employees who are profit sharing participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides Supplemental Profit Sharing Plans solely to maintain an equal percentage of profit sharing compensation contribution to approximately 215 employees, including NEOs, who would be subject to contribution or compensation limitations imposed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT   W.W. GRAINGER, INC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: on qualified plans by the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not provide any other supplemental retirement benefits to its NEOs or other employees based in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profit sharing is the primary Company-sponsored retirement vehicle for U.S.-based employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Profit sharing aligns the interests of the Company's employees, management, and shareholders as the Company's annual contribution to profit sharing is based on ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company contributes a minimum of 8% of payroll to the plan and provides employees the opportunity to share in the success of the Company beyond this amount only if a threshold return on capital, as the same may be adjusted for all eligible employees under the terms of the Profit Sharing Plan, is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the 2016 Profit Sharing Plan, the Company implemented a 401(k) feature for all U.S.-based employees including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will contribute 3% of pay to the 401(k) feature and this amount is funded from the profit sharing pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As mentioned above, the minimum Company contribution is 8% of pay with the first 3% going into the 401(k).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective April 2011, the Company requires that the NEOs and certain other Company officers have periodic physical examinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that periodic physical exams are important to maintain the effectiveness of its executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 31, 2009, the Company discontinued its executive death benefit program for executives hired or promoted after this date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs (except for Mr. High and Ms. Robbins) and certain other Company officers have grandfathered participation in the Company's former Executive Death Benefit Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The beneficiary of a participant who dies while employed by the Company is entitled to a taxable benefit of 120 monthly payments of 50% of the participant's monthly compensation, calculated on the basis of salary and target annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless offered to other Company employees, the Company will not make payments, grants, or awards following the death of an executive in the form of unearned salary or unearned bonuses, accelerated vesting or the continuation in force of unvested equity grants, awards or ungranted equity, perquisites, and other payments or awards made in lieu of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2017, the Company discontinued its U.S. pre-tax deferred compensation program whereby NEOs and certain other officers could elect to defer receipt of up to 50% of base salary and 85% of annual cash incentives under the 2004 Voluntary Salary and Incentive Deferral Plan, an unfunded deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the plan was to provide executives with retirement savings and financial planning opportunities that were unavailable to them in tax-qualified retirement plans due to Internal Revenue Code limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investment choices and returns for the nonqualified program were the same as those offered to participants in profit sharing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs were eligible to be reimbursed for up to $10,000 in financial services in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial service reimbursements are fully taxable and not grossed-up to cover taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers are allowed the business use of corporate aircraft and car and driver, while each of Messrs. Ryan and Macpherson is also allowed personal use of a car and driver, subject to reimbursement of the incremental cost of use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits represent a cost-effective method of allowing the Company's top executives to more effectively use their time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other benefits, including the profit sharing contribution percentages and various welfare benefits provided to U.S. NEOs and other executive officers, are comparable to those provided to the majority of salaried and hourly U.S.-based Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Contracts, Change in Control Arrangements, and Termination of Employment Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not maintain any employment agreements with its Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in ControlEquity Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Company's 2015 Incentive Plan, which is the source for all equity awards granted after April 2015, "double trigger" vesting provisions apply to all equity awards (i.e., both a change in control occurs and a participant is involuntarily terminated within one year of the change in control).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has 2x Change in Control Agreements (CIC Agreements) with a number of executives, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These CIC Agreements are intended to ensure that in the event of a pending or threatened change in control, the Company retains its management and that their full attention is focused on the best interests of the Company and its shareholders and not on the uncertainty of their future employment prospects under those circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company's CIC Agreements have double-trigger arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under each CIC Agreement, the executive is entitled to certain benefits which include a lump-sum payment equal to 2x the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the executive's annual salary,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the executive's target annual incentive, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in connection with the Company's non-contributory profit sharing plans, a percentage of annual salary and annual incentive equal to the average percentage of covered compensation contributed by the Company under the plans for the last three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive is also entitled to two years of continued health and dental benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has committed that no more than 10 positions will be eligible for CIC Agreements in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Existing agreements remain in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation; Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally disallows a federal income tax deduction to a public company for compensation over $1 million per iscal year paid to the Company's NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation that qualifies as "performance-based" compensation is not subject to the deductibility limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Company objective is to attempt to maximize the deductibility of compensation under Section 162(m) to the extent doing so is reasonable and consistent with Company strategies and goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the annual incentive plan in which the NEOs participate, gains on exercises of stock options, and shares eceived as the result of performance share awards and PRSUs are considered to be "performance-based" compensation not subject to the Section 162(m) deductibility limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards of RSUs are not exempt from the Section 162(m) deductibility limit and all or a portion of these awards may be nondeductible when he awards vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the tax treatment applicable to the Company's compensation programs was taken into account in designing those programs, it was not a significant consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not time the grant of long-term incentive awards in respect of the release of material, non-public information nor for the purpose of affecting the value of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon vesting, settlement, or maturity, equity awards under the 2015 Incentive Plan and predecessor plans are distributed in the form of shares of the Company's common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 718 (formerly FAS 123R), these types of awards are considered equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the total amount of compensation expense to be recorded for the awards is based on the fair value of the awards on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This fair value is then recorded over the vesting period, usually three years, and is recorded to compensation expense and as an increase in paid-in capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of compensation expense is not subsequently adjusted for changes in the Company's share price, but it is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an equity award is forfeited, all previously recorded compensation expensed is reversed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the accounting treatment described above was considered in the development of the long-term incentive program, it was not a material consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recoupment Policy (Clawbacks)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2010 the Company expanded the executive compensation recoupment policy (or clawback) for equity and annual incentive payments made to officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company can recover incentive compensation (cash or equity) that was awarded based on achievement of financial results that were the subject of a restatement if the officer engaged in criminal conduct or financial fraud.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also permits the recovery of all or a portion of any incentive compensation in the case of materially inaccurate financial statements whether or not they result in a restatement and whether or not the executive officer has engaged in wrongful conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, should an executive violate his or her confidentiality or non-compete obligations, any award is automatically forfeited, and in certain circumstances, the executive must return vested shares and/or gains from disposition of shares to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoveries under these provisions can extend back for three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy applies to any incentive compensation awarded or paid to an employee at a time when he or she is an officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsequent changes in status, including retirement or termination of employment, do not impact the Company's rights to recover compensation under this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have employment contracts and does not maintain severance programs for its NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive's CIC Agreements provide the potential for a lump sum payment following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for a limited period of time following a change in control, the NEOs are not entitled to severance upon termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The definition of retirement eligibility is the same for all U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this definition, an employee is retirement-eligible upon attaining any of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: age 60;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: age 55 and 20 years of service; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 25 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ryan and Mr. High are retirement-eligible
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides the following upon retirement for all employees, including NEO's:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outstanding stock options become vested and executives have the right to exercise such stock options within six years from date of termination or for the remaining term of the stock option, whichever is less;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grainger's Business Conduct Guidelines require that conflicts of interest in any form be avoided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted written policies and procedures, to be applied by the Board Affairs and Nominating Committee, for the review, approval, or ratification of any transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those policies and procedures apply to any proposed transaction in which Grainger is a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and any director, executive officer, or significant shareholder or any immediate family member of such a person has a direct or material indirect interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy requires that any such proposed transaction be reviewed by the Board Affairs and Nominating Committee to determine, among other things, the benefits of the transaction to Grainger, the availability of other sources of comparable products or services, and whether the terms of the proposed transaction are comparable to those provided to unrelated third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal to Consider and Hold an Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Grainger's Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is asking its shareholders for their non-binding advisory approval of the compensation of its Named Executive Officers (Say on Pay) as disclosed in the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" section of this proxy statement in accordance with the SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail under "Compensation Discussion and Analysis," the Company's compensation program is based upon a philosophy that is applied to all Company employeesto attract and retain the best people and provide appropriate performance-based incentives that encourage them to achieve results that create long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company sets target compensation for the Named Executive Officers to approximate the market median of compensation at companies of similar size and complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees at all levels of the Company, including its executives, are provided clear incentives to grow the business (Sales Growth) while achieving investment returns (Return on Invested Capital or ROIC) for the Company's shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program is structured to significantly reward long-term performance while not encouraging excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please read the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" beginning on page 35 for additional details about the compensation of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Say on Pay vote is intended to address the compensation of the Named Executive Officers as disclosed in the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" section of this proxy statement as a whole rather than any specific item or amount of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our shareholders to vote "FOR" the following advisory resolution at the Company's 2016 annual meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Resolved, that the compensation of the Company's Named Executive Officers, as disclosed in the "Compensation Discussion and Analysis" section of this proxy statement, including the related tables, notes and narrative is hereby approved by the Company's shareholders."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on the compensation of Grainger's Named Executive Officers is determined by the votes of a majority of the shares represented in person or by proxy at the meeting and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the same effect as votes against the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will not affect the outcome of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Say on Pay vote is advisory and non-binding on the Company, our Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee of the Board, which is comprised of independent directors, expect to take into account the outcome of this Say on Pay vote when making future compensation decisions regarding Grainger's Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR the approval of the advisory resolution on the compensation of Grainger's Named Executive Officers.

sentences.text: Proposal to Consider and Hold an Advisory Vote on the Frequency of the Advisory Vote on the Compensation of Grainger's Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is asking shareholders to cast an advisory vote on how often they wish to hold a shareholder advisory vote on Named Executive Officer compensation (Say on Pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are being asked to vote on whether the Say on Pay vote should occur every one year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee of the Board believe that shareholders should have a frequent opportunity to provide the Company with input on its executive compensation and therefore, recommend that shareholders vote for an annual (one year) interval for the shareholder advisory vote on Say on Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a majority of the votes are not cast for one option, the Board of Directors will consider the option of once every one, two or three years that receives the highest number of votes cast as the shareholders' preferred choice of voting frequency for the advisory vote on Say on Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board of Directors and the Compensation Committee of the Board value the opinions of the Company's shareholders and will consider the outcome of the vote, because this vote is advisory and not binding on the Company, Board of Directors or the Compensation Committee of the Board, the Board and the Compensation Committee may decide it is in the best interests of the shareholders and the Company to hold an advisory vote on Say on Pay more or less frequently than the option receiving the most votes of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast your vote on your preferred choice of voting frequency by choosing the option of voting every one year, every two years, or every three years or you may abstain from voting, on the enclosed proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not affect the outcome of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the recommendation of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote for every "ONE YEAR" as the frequency for shareholder advisory votes on the compensation of Grainger's Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CATEGORICAL STANDARDS FOR DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director's independence will not be deemed to be impaired by reason of his or her service as an executive officer of another company that does business with Grainger if in each of the three most recent fiscal years the other company's annual sales to Grainger are less than one percent (1%) of that company's consolidated gross revenues and if in each of the three most recent fiscal years Grainger's sales to the other company are less than one percent (1%) of that company's consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax-Exempt Contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director's independence will not be deemed to be impaired by reason of his or her service as an officer, director or trustee of a tax-exempt organization that receives contributions from Grainger if Grainger's contributions to the organization are less than one percent (1%) of the organization's total annual contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
